hs.name: Burton High School.jpg
hs.heading: Burton High School.jpg
hs.subtitle: JPG image — 120 KB
hs.description: I took every opportunity that came my way and graduated top of my class, ran with varsity cross country, led buildOn as a global education officer, and volunteered hundreds of hours.

college.name: UC Berkeley.jpg
college.heading: UC Berkeley.jpg
college.subtitle: JPG image — 362 KB
college.description: Through participating in organizations and activities around campus, developing at internships, and making my fair share of mistakes, I learned a lot about myself, my purpose, and my potential as well as how to better navigate life's ups and downs.

major.name: Cognitive Science Major.pdf
major.heading: Cognitive Science Major.pdf
major.subtitle: PDF Document — 113 KB
major.description: After a lot of contemplation and multiple major switches, I settled on Cognitive Science, a very interdisciplinary major suiting my multifaceted background and interests. Within Cognitive Science, my concentrations were in psychology and computer science.

adobe.name: Adobe.jpg
adobe.heading: Adobe.jpg
adobe.subtitle: Software Engineer
adobe.description: I'm currently working with a platform team within Adobe Experience Cloud to incrementally improve upon and expand the features of our framework used by dozens of Experience Cloud applications.

climate.name: The Climate Corporation.jpg
climate.heading: The Climate Corporation.jpg
climate.subtitle: Software Engineer, Intern
climate.description: This was my first internship at a company that wasn't an early stage startup, which meant I gained a deeper understanding of the standards within the industry along with how to navigate a larger codebase within a larger team.

stowk.name: Stowk Inc.jpg
stowk.heading: Stowk Inc.jpg
stowk.subtitle: Full Stack Engineer, Web/Mobile
stowk.description: Stowk was an interesting ride for many reasons. It was a very early stage startup, and I had to wear many, many hats. Over time I went from intern to front-end part-timer to full-stack engineer to team lead. There were ups and downs, late nights, and stress about funding, but I have no doubt this was the experience I learned the most from thus far.

registria.name: Registria.png
registria.heading: Registria.png
registria.subtitle: Front End Web Developer
registria.description: This was the first real development job I snagged in the fall of my sophomore year of college, right after self-learning how to code in the summer. I shoved my foot in the door of the software industry, and I am forever grateful for the opportunity and my super supportive manager. My journey began here.

wdd.name: Web Design DeCal.jpg
wdd.heading: Web Design DeCal.jpg
wdd.subtitle: Web Development Instructor
wdd.description: Becoming instructor for fall 202018 after TAing in spring 202018 was at the same time an honor and a challenge. During this time, after years of using outdate resources, my co-instructors and I took it upon ourselves to revamp the curriculum, website, lecture materials, and class resources while also preparing for a new semester of 120+ students and training a new cohort of TAs. It was chaotic, but ultimately very fulfilling to spread the power of web design and development to students of all majors.

aaa.name: Asian American Assoc.jpg
aaa.heading: Asian American Assoc.jpg
aaa.subtitle: Internal Relations Head
aaa.description: "AAA is where I made 90% of my friends" is a line I've heard from more than a dozen people, including myself. While a lot of my other experiences are technical and targeted towards a career in software engineering, this experience stands out as leadership and community-focused.

ffl.name: Foundation for Letters.pdf
ffl.heading: Foundation for Letters.pdf
ffl.subtitle: Lead Web Developer
ffl.description: FFL was my first experience volunteering for a nonprofit using tech. This foray taught me that nonprofit administration and teams operate very differently, and the same knowledge found within the tech industry cannot be expected, but it is very possible to be productive in spite of that.

desktop.name: Desktop.vue
desktop.heading: Desktop.vue
desktop.subtitle: Vue
desktop.description: I believe the desktop is the window to a developer's soul. You are currently staring at the personal portfolio I modeled after my own Mac desktop.

cschwebsite.name: CSCH Website.js
cschwebsite.heading: CSCH Website.js
cschwebsite.subtitle: Next.js, Node
cschwebsite.description: Website based on Next.js for the CS Career Hub nonprofit, which connects a community of software engineers on a mission of lifelong-learning with peers, mentors, and mock interviewers.

cschmegabot.name: CSCH Megabot.js
cschmegabot.heading: CS Career Hub.js
cschmegabot.subtitle: Next.js, Node
cschmegabot.description: A megabot for everything CS Career Hub needs, created with Discord.js

indiestorygames.name: Indie Story Games.js
indiestorygames.heading: Indie Story Games.js
indiestorygames.subtitle: Gatsby, Node
indiestorygames.description: Indie Story Games is an indie gaming website focused on games with a story to tell and the developers behind them. I wear multiple hats and lead technological development, growth, and publishing. With a global team of writers, editors, and indie game enthusiasts, I hope to grow into our vision of becoming the definitive site for story-rich indie games.

stopbot.name: Discord Stop Bot.js
stopbot.heading: Discord Stop Bot.js
stopbot.subtitle: Node, PostgreSQL, Discord.js
stopbot.description: Stop Bot is a message moderation bot for Discord. Though it began as a joke between friends, I quickly realized it had the potential to be really useful for others and developed it into a general message moderation bot. Currently, it is active in over 2,000 Discord servers with 90,000+ users.

perks.name: Perks Guide Redesign.js
perks.heading: Perks Guide Redesign.js
perks.subtitle: React
perks.description: Building on top of the concept of the original Perks.Guide to add more companies, better filtering, and cleaner UI.

rolley.name: Rolley.py
rolley.heading: Rolley.py
rolley.subtitle: Node, Discord.js
rolley.description: A Python-based role management bot for Discord, where members of a server use emoji reacts to self-assign roles.

refero.name: Referobot.js
refero.heading: Referobot.js
refero.subtitle: Node, Discord.js
refero.description: A referral bot for referral-based Discord servers. It counts and displays the number of invites each user has, their current rank, the number of invites until their next rank, and the name of a user's next rank. It also shows the top 10 ranking referrers.

da.name: Devil's Advocate.html
da.heading: Devil's Advocate.html
da.subtitle: HTML, CSS, jQuery, Node
da.description: This project by Jeffrey Webb was a weekly newsletter that sent political articles that subscribers would disagree with in order to foster more open-minded dialog. I built a website for hosting the survey, blog, and social media integrations along with a backend for automatically categorizing subscribers and assigning MailChimp tags based on survey answers.

liquefy.name: Liquefy Web App.js
liquefy.heading: Liquefy Web App.js
liquefy.subtitle: React
liquefy.description: Liquid language filtering app for non-technical Registria staff. Input any block of code with Liquid templating, and it’ll filter it for the Liquid snippets. The results are searchable by Liquid tags.

notion.name: Notion Board.pdf
notion.heading: Notion Board.pdf
notion.subtitle: PDF file — 65 KB
notion.description: Repurposed a Notion workspace, my favorite platform, to serve as an alternate personal portfolio.

quotes.name: Quotes.pdf
quotes.heading: Quotes.pdf
quotes.subtitle: PDF file — 31 KB
quotes.description: Words, important words. I live by these.

writingportfolio.name: Writing Portfolio.pdf
writingportfolio.heading: Writing Portfolio.pdf
writingportfolio.subtitle: Notion
writingportfolio.description: A collection of all my writings, sorted by publisher and year.

composely.name: Composely.pdf
composely.heading: Composely.pdf
composely.subtitle: Website
composely.description: I am currently a freelance writer, specializing in finance and technology, on Composely.

indiestorygames.name: Indie Story Games.pdf
indiestorygames.heading: Indie Story Games.pdf
indiestorygames.subtitle: Author Page
indiestorygames.description: My author profile on Indie Story Games.
